business.headline: DNPA hosts key AI and journalism dialogue at IndiaAI Impact Summit 2026The session brought together senior leaders from India's most influential news organisations along with global publishing representation to examine how artificial intelligence is transforming journalism, and how India must shape that transformation responsibly.
Draft income tax rules 2026 could change your tax forms: What it means for you?Under the draft new law, statutory forms such as Form 26AS, Form 16 and Form 13 will be issued with new numbers.

Sensex, Nifty close higher as IT and PSU banking stocks rally; Infosys up 2%The IT sector played a key role in lifting the markets. The Nifty IT index, which is the second-heaviest sector on the benchmarks, climbed 1%. Shares of Infosys rose 1.9% after the company announced a partnership with US-based artificial intelligence firm Anthropic.

Are millennials and Gen Z behind 90–95% of India's home purchases?For many borrowers under 40, applying for a home loan online is no longer optional, it is the preferred way. Around 72% of borrowers in this age group choose digital applications, and nearly half of borrowers above 60 are also getting comfortable with online processes.

Cochin Shipyard, HAL, BEL: Are defence stocks set for a strong comeback?The defence theme is back on screens. Now it needs breadth, sustained volumes and follow-through to turn early strength into a lasting rally.

Adani Group announces $100 billion to build AI-ready, green data centres by 2035The $100 billion direct investment is expected to catalyse an additional $150 billion across related sectors over the next decade. These include server manufacturing, advanced electrical infrastructure, sovereign cloud platforms, and semiconductor and compute ecosystems.

Star Health rejects Lucknow man's viral allegation over mother's claim rejectionIn a post, the man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year as premium for his mother's health insurance policy. When she fell ill, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance to seek claim support.

Gold drops over Rs 2,500, silver falls Rs 6,000: Are bigger price cuts on the way?Gold and silver have taken a sharp hit, shaking confidence after weeks of strong gains. As volatility rises, investors are trying to understand whether this decline signals a larger trend shift.

Changed your salary account? Here's what happens to your PF withdrawals nowUpdating your account when there is no urgency is far easier than scrambling to fix it when you need funds quickly. Think of it as preventive maintenance for your finances.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech gain up to 3%: Why are IT stocks rising today?The main trigger for the rally was Infosys announcing a strategic partnership with artificial intelligence firm Anthropic. Investors reacted positively to the news, pushing Infosys shares nearly 3% higher to around Rs 1,407 during the session.

Infosys shares jump 3% today after announcing partnership with AnthropicThis new partnership will help companies in tough, rule-heavy sectors use AI better, and improve efficiency in providing essential services to the public.
Sensex, Nifty open lower but IT stocks rallyThe S&P BSE added 42.49 points to 83,319.64, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.05 points to 25,665.70 as of 10:10 am.

Global tech giants see billions erased amid rising AI cost concernsInvestors who once rewarded bold AI plans are now asking tougher questions about spending, profits and competition. Several of the largest US technology firms have lost hundreds of billions of dollars in market value since the start of 2026.

India–US trade deal advances with focus on finalising legal agreementSpeaking on the development, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said a joint statement outlining the contours of the agreement has already been signed. He said that these contours now need to be converted into a formal legal agreement.

Record MSP procurement: How many farmers are actually benefiting?India's MSP system is clearly expanding, with higher spending, larger procurement and more beneficiaries than before. Yet the debate has shifted from scale to security.
Sensex rallies over 600 points: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 650.39 points to close at 83,277.15, while the NSE Nifty50 added 211.65 points to end at 25,682.75.

How cash levels in mutual funds impact returns during volatile marketsIn the current market, volatility caused by global and external factors has led some mutual funds to increase their cash positions. The idea is to lower risk and protect portfolios from sudden corrections.

Can NPS help you save tax in the new regime? What salaried employees must knowFor salaried workers who have moved to the new tax regime, tax saving can feel limited. This has led many to question if there are still practical ways to ease their tax burden. Let's have a look.

Can your employer refuse gratuity if you get pension? Here's what employees must knowMany employees assume that receiving a pension from their employer means they may have to give up gratuity. But the law draws a clear distinction between the two. A recent court ruling has clarified what workers should know about their rights.

Why Mumbai remains India's top luxury housing hubThe global recognition Mumbai is receiving today is best understood as validation rather than arrival. International research now ranks the city among the world's fastest-growing luxury housing markets, reflecting sustained price appreciation at the very top end.

entertainment.headline: Amul celebrates Farhan's Ravi Shankar act in The Beatles with quirky topical Amul India has celebrated Farhan Akhtar's Hollywood debut as Ravi Shankar with a witty topical. Here's why the casting is making waves.

Salim Khan shifted to ICU, doctors confirm he is stable Salman Khan's father, Salim Khan, has been shifted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the Lilavati Hospital under the observation of experts. The doctor, in a press statement, claimed that he is currently stable.

Rajpal Yadav expresses gratitude to High Court following interim bail from Tihar Rajpal Yadav expressed gratitude to the film industry and his fans after being granted interim bail by the High Court. Addressing a cheque bounce case, the actor mentioned he remains ready to answer all allegations and thanked the judiciary for the relief.

Why were Akshay Kumar's parents denied entry to his first show? Actor shares During an episode of Wheel of Fortune, Akshay Kumar recalled how his parents were unable to attend his first stage performance in Punjab. The actor also shared that the security staff thought that his father was intoxicated.

Rollercoaster gone rogue: Shanaya recalls Aryan Khan's prank on her and Suhana Actor Shanaya Kapoor shared a childhood memory where she and Suhana Khan were pushed down the stairs by Aryan Khan. The confession came as she was promoting her latest film, Tu Yaa Main, alongside co-star Adarsh Gourav.

Dia Mirza says storytelling can encourage climate action and change Bollywood actor Dia Mirza combined climate urgency with cultural wisdom in her Harvard keynote. What powerful message did she leave students with?

Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda's slow-burn love story heads to the altar Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to marry on February 26 in an intimate ceremony. From their first film together in 2018 to years of speculation, their slow-burn romance has shaped away from the spotlight.

I am a Shiva devotee: Prakash Raj reveals his character in Rajamouli's Varanasi Prakash Raj confirms his role in SS Rajamouli's mythological film, Varanasi. The actor adds star power to the film, which features Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and Prithviraj Sukumaran in lead roles.

Sunny Deol's Gabru set for May release following Border 2 success. Check date here Sunny Deol's next film, Gabru, is set for theatrical release on May 8, following the recent success of Border 2. Directed by Shashank Udapurkar, the movie features themes of courage, identity, and resilience.

Adarsh Gourav urges viewers to back Tu Yaa Main: We're off to a slow start Admitting Tu Yaa Main has had a slow start, actor Adarsh Gourav on Tuesday urged audiences to watch the film in theatres. He also stressed the need to support smaller commercial films.

AR Rahman takes 40-day digital break before Ramayana event: Report Singer AR Rahman has stepped away from social media for 40 days as a major Ramayana milestone approaches. What's behind the sudden digital silence?

Priyanka Chopra moved by saree-clad students at Harvard: The India I imagined Priyanka Chopra Jonas shared her feelings of pride and hope as she addressed students during an India Week session at Harvard Business School. She highlighted the importance of representation and recalled her own experiences as a young Indian in the US.

Govinda ditched live event and forced his team to flee in bus, says Abu Malik Abu Malik revealed how Govinda skipped a live show in Pusad, leaving 15,000 fans waiting. To avoid a riot, Abu's brother, Daboo Malik, performed in a dancer's costume to mimic the star. The entire crew eventually fled in a bus to escape the confrontation.

Court gives four weeks to ministry for consular access to Celina Jaitly's brother The Delhi High Court has granted the Ministry of External Affairs additional time to obtain consular access and facilitate a meeting with Celina Jaitly's brother, Major Vikrant Jaitly, who has been detained in the United Arab Emirates.

The Night Manager is 3: Anil Kapoor reveals the scene that reflects his early life Actor Anil Kapoor marked the third anniversary of The Night Manager by sharing how a pivotal scene resonated with his personal journey. The series also featured Aditya Roy Kapur and Sobhita Dhulipala.

Women in Cinema Collective to honour 2017 assault survivor with candlelight vigil The Women in Cinema Collective (WCC) has called for Avalkoppam candlelight gatherings across Kerala on February 17, marking the anniversary of the 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Brilliant without flamboyance: Anupam Kher honours Robert Duvall Veteran actor Anupam Kher has expressed deep admiration for Hollywood legend Robert Duvall. He shared a heartfelt tribute that highlighted Duvall's understated yet impactful approach to acting.

Neena Gupta calls out deep-rooted patriarchy in India: Things have not changed Neena Gupta has questioned claims of social progress in India, saying patriarchy continues to shape women's lives within households. Citing personal examples, she stressed that deep-rooted expectations around marriage and virginity still persist.

Salim Khan, actor Salman Khan's father, hospitalised in Mumbai Veteran screenwriter Salim Khan, father of superstar Salman Khan, was hospitalised in Mumbai on Tuesday. More details on his health are awaited.

general news.headline: Defence partnership, AI collaboration: India-France sign 20 agreements to boost tiesFrench President Emmanuel Macron is on a three-day visit to India to attend the AI Summit 2026 in New Delhi and to hold high-level discussions with the Indian leadership.

Iran fires missiles into Strait of Hormuz amid nuclear talks with US in GenevaThe missiles launched from within Iran and along its coast struck targets in the Strait of Hormuz during drills. Authorities also announced temporary closure of parts of the waterway for safety during live-fire exercises.

Minister apologises for AI Summit Day 1 issues, promises smoother experienceUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw apologised for the issues witnessed on the opening day of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, calling the turnout "phenomenal". He said the government is committed to addressing concerns to ensure a smoother experience for attendees.

Australia out, Zimbabwe reach Super 8 stage after Pallekele washoutT20 World Cup, IRE vs ZIM: Australia have been knocked out of the competition after the clash between Ireland and Zimbabwe in Pallekele on Tuesday was abandoned due to rain. The abandoned fixture sealed Zimbabwe's qualification for the Super 8 stage alongside Sri Lanka from Group B.

Tarique Rahman becomes PM, but is Yunus the real winner in Bangladesh?As BNP's Tarique Rahman takes oath today, Muhammad Yunus has emerged as the biggest winner in Bangladesh. He pulled off most things he set out to do in the last 18 months and conducted an election by barring his bete noire, Sheikh Hasina's Awami League, from it. How did an 85-year-old Yunus manage to get things done his way?

Video shows SUV ramming Delhi biker head-on, mother says teen was filming reelsThe mother of a 23-year-old man who died in a road accident last week has released a video, claiming it captures the exact moment an SUV, driven by a 17-year-old, hit her son.

India to further squeeze water flow to Pakistan ahead of summerWater woes for Pakistan are unlikely to end soon. Ahead of a harsh summer, India is now set to block surplus water flow from the Ravi River to Pakistan with the completion of the Shahpur Kandi barrage. How will it impact Pakistan? Read on to find out.

Why US envoy's rare Army command visit near Pakistan border sparked buzzA routine visit by the US envoy and the US Indo-Pacific commander to the Indian Army's Western Command near the Pakistan border has generated considerable buzz. This is the first such high-profile visit after Operation Sindoor. But, behind the optics, lies a broader message.

Indore man killed girlfriend, abused corpse, searched YouTube to speak to spiritThe man who murdered his girlfriend in Indore admitted to violating her corpse afterwards. He later searched on YouTube for ways to communicate with spirits.

Live: What if your Class 10 Maths test didn't go well?The CBSE Board Exams 2026 have officially commenced today for Class 10 and Class 12, with more than 43 lakh students appearing across examination centres nationwide. Exams are being held in a single shift from 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, so timely arrival at centres is crucial. Get complete exam day guidelines, last-minute preparation tips, dress code rules, and all essential updates to ensure a smooth and stress-free exam experience. Stay tuned for the latest news and live updates from the CBSE Board Exams 2026.

NGT clears path for India's Hong Kong. What's the Great Nicobar Project?The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has refused to interfere with the environmental clearance for the Rs 81,000-crore Great Nicobar Project. This effectively removes a major legal hurdle and allows the mega strategic plan to move forward. Here's what you need to know about India's most ambitious island infrastructure push that aims to challenge Chinese assertion in the Indo-Pacific.

Live: India-France partnership force for global stability amid uncertainty, says PMPM Modi-Macron Mumbai Meeting Live Updates: French President Emmanuel Macron arrived in Mumbai on Monday night along with First Lady Brigitte Macron on a three-day official visit (February 17-19) to India, during which Artificial Intelligence (AI) and strategic cooperation are expected to feature prominently in talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. This is Macron's fourth official visit to India, and through his post on X, he acknowledged that this visit would strengthen the strategic co-operation between India and France. The French President on Tuesday paid homage to the victims of 26/11. Catch all the live updates in indiatoday.in

Priyanka Chopra moved by saree-clad students at Harvard: The India I imaginedPriyanka Chopra Jonas shared her feelings of pride and hope as she addressed students during an India Week session at Harvard Business School. She highlighted the importance of representation and recalled her own experiences as a young Indian in the US.

Live: Om Birla meets Tarique Rahman, invites him to IndiaTarique Rahman Oath Ceremony live updates: Tarique Rahman Oath Ceremony live updates: The BNP government led by Tarique Rahman took oath on Tuesday. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla was present in Dhaka and took part in the swearing-in. MPs of the Jamaat and the NCP boycotted the ceremony.

300/300 in JEE Main: Hardware shop owner's son from Gaya gets perfect 100 percentileShubham Kumar, the son of a small hardware shop owner from Gaya, Bihar, has scored a perfect 300 out of 300 and 100 percentile in JEE Main 2026, emerging as the Bihar topper and All India Rank 3. Raised in a modest household in the Brahmani Ghat locality, Shubham's journey proves that determination and discipline matter more than privilege.

Unable to bear son's death, Chhattisgarh couple dies by suicide, leaves videoThe neighbours came under suspicion after not noticing any movement from the couple for a long time. They soon looked through the window and found that the couple was hanging from a tree.

Diners are paying Rs 26,000 to get chocolate poured on their hands, but why?Imagine walking into a Michelin-starred restaurant in your fanciest outfit, ready to document every dish, only to be asked to wash your hands with chocolate.

Fierce face-off amid Bangladesh oath-taking, Jamaat bloc threatens street protestsStreet agitation like it was seen against the Sheikh Hasina regime could return to Bangladesh over the July Charter. On the day of the swearing-in of the Tarique Rahman-led government, the Jamaat and the NCP have warned of street protests, calling the BNP a "fascist" force.

Treat Imran Khan fairly: Kapil, Gavaskar join 14 captains in appeal to Pak govtFormer India captains Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar have joined a rare global cricketing appeal seeking better treatment for Imran Khan, the former Pakistan Prime Minister and 1992 World Cup-winning captain, who remains in jail amid growing health concerns.
Watch Live: Annular ring of fire solar eclipse begins to dim the SunThe reason the full annular eclipse is visible only in Antarctica lies in the geometry of the Moon's shadow.

Maruti Suzuki e Vitara launched in India at Rs 10.99 lakhMaruti Suzuki, has launched the e Vitara at Rs 10.99 lakh, marking its entry into the mid-size electric SUV segment, competing against the likes of Hyundai Creta Electric, Tata Curvv EV, MG Windsor, Mahindra BE 6 and VinFast VF 6.
The harsh truth about breastfeeding no one tells new mothersInside the emotional, biological and social battle new mothers face when feeding their newborns

Delhi teen opens doors of moving cars, buses on road to record reel, sparks outrageA Delhi teen opened doors of moving vehicles while riding a motorcycle on the road to record Instragram reels. The incident raised serious concerns about road safety and reckless behaviour on public roads.

US civil rights icon Jesse Jackson dies at 84Jesse Jackson advocated for the rights of Black Americans and other marginalised communities dating back to the turbulent civil rights movement of the 1960s spearheaded by his mentor Martin Luther King Jr.

sports.headline: Scotland vs Nepal Live Score T20 World Cup 2026 updates from Mumbai Scotland (SCO) vs Nepal (NEP) Live Score, T20 World Cup: Both teams have been knocked out of the competition and will be looking to finish their campaign on a positive note.

Australia out, Zimbabwe reach Super 8 stage after Pallekele washout T20 World Cup, IRE vs ZIM: Australia have been knocked out of the competition after the clash between Ireland and Zimbabwe in Pallekele on Tuesday was abandoned due to rain. The abandoned fixture sealed Zimbabwe's qualification for the Super 8 stage alongside Sri Lanka from Group B.

IND-PAK conflict could force future World Cup out of India: Report T20 World Cup: The geopolitical conflict between India and Pakistan might force future ICC tournaments outside the subcontinent, Australian media reported on February 16. As per the report, Australia could be the favoured destination.

Lone female on grid,  F1 aspirant Atiqa Mir climbs higher on WSK ladder Indian racing prodigy Atiqa has shown skill and maturity beyond her years after making a voluntary switch from the Mini to the far more demanding Junior category, producing standout performances in the early part of her 2026 international karting season.

IRE vs ZIM highlights : Australia out, Zimbabwe reach Super 8 after washout Ireland (IRE) vs Zimbabwe (ZIM) Highlights, T20 World Cup: The Group clash between Ireland cricket team and Zimbabwe cricket team in Pallekele was washed out due to heavy rain. The shared point confirmed Zimbabwe's place in the Super 8 and knocked out Ireland and 2021 champions Australia national cricket team from the tournament.

New Zealand storm into Super 8s, knock Afghanistan out of T20 World Cup T20 World Cup: New Zealand stormed into the Super 8s with an eight-wicket win over Canada in Chennai. Glen Phillips and Rachin Ravindra's chase ended Afghanistan's campaign despite Yuvraj Samra's record-breaking century.

Pratika Rawal added to ODI squad for Australia tour after long injury lay off Star batter Pratika Rawal has been added to India's ODI squad after recovering from an ankle injury. India are set to take on Australia in a three-match ODI series beginning on February 24.

Treat Imran Khan fairly: Kapil, Gavaskar join 14 captains in appeal to Pak govt Former India captains Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar have joined a rare global cricketing appeal seeking better treatment for Imran Khan, the former Pakistan Prime Minister and 1992 World Cup-winning captain, who remains in jail amid growing health concerns.

FIH Pro League: Hardik Singh to lead India in Hobart leg; Harmanpreet ruled out Midfielder Hardik Singh was named captain of the embattled Indian men's hockey team for its FIH Pro League matches in Hobart from February 20 to 25 after regular skipper Harmanpreet Singh opted out due to "personal reasons."

Canada's Yuvraj Samra becomes youngest centurion in T20 World Cup history Canada opener Yuvraj Samra became the youngest centurion in men's T20 World Cup history during Canada's clash against New Zealand at the M. A. Chidambaram Stadium.

Shami scalps 8 wickets in Ranji semis, puts India selectors on high alert Mohammed Shami put India selectors on alert with an eight-wicket haul for Bengal in the Ranji Trophy semi-final against Jammu & Kashmir. The veteran pacer now has 38 wickets this season.

Ian Healy slams Australia's selection calls after defeat vs Sri LankaAUS vs SL, T20 World Cup: Former Australia wicketkeeper Ian Healy has strongly criticised the team's selection after a heavy defeat to Sri Lanka. Australia now face an uphill battle to qualify for the Super 8 with their final group match against Oman.

Gambhir to join Rajasthan Royals? IPL franchise approach India coachRajasthan Royals have approached India head coach Gautam Gambhir for a senior role in their setup amid an ownership change. However, Gambhir is unlikely to accept due to conflict-of-interest rules and national commitments.

Abhishek Sharma, just take a single first: Gavaskar's advice to India openerT20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar offered simple advice to Abhishek Sharma amid his tough start to the T20 World Cup. The former captain urged him to get off the mark first before unleashing his attacking game.

Did Pakistan players wait to shake hands with India after Colombo defeat?India defeated Pakistan by 61 runs in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 fixture. The Men in Blue maintained their no handshake policy against the arch-rivals.

Shoaib Akhtar's rapid U-turn: Mohsin Naqvi incompetent to good man in 24 hoursT20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar made a quick U-turn on his criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi after Pakistan's humiliating loss to India. Akhtar said his "incompetent" remark was twisted and Naqvi is "a good guy."

Smriti Mandhana named Indian sportswoman of the yearSmriti Mandhana was named BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year after a standout 2025 season. The opener starred in India's Women's World Cup triumph and also won another WPL title with RCB.

Jose Mourinho's Benfica not banking on miracles against a wounded Real MadridJose Mourinho says Real Madrid are a wounded king ahead of their Champions League clash with Benfica and insists his side need near perfection, not a miracle, to advance.

How Sri Lanka learned from Australia's mistakes to secure Super 8 spotT20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka said Sri Lanka knew Australia were 20 runs short, planned a calm 12-over approach and executed perfectly to seal an eight-wicket win and Super 8 spot.

How can Australia seal Super 8 spot after shock Sri Lanka defeat?T20 World Cup 2026: Australia's Super 8 hopes hang by a thread after Sri Lanka's win, with Mitchell Marsh admitting they now need "the luck of the Irish" to stay alive.

How 2 ex-India coaches planned Australia's downfall in T20 World CupSri Lanka vs Australia: Co-hosts Sri Lanka qualified for the Super 8s by beating Australia in Pallekele. After the game, head coach Sanath Jayasuriya explained how two Indian coaches helped him shape this Sri Lankan side.

Matchday Preview: New Zealand hunt Super 8 spot, AFG stare at knockoutICC T20 World Cup: It is time for Matchday 11 in the T20 World Cup 2026. A couple of big games will decide the fate of the two very important teams in Group B and D.

Kohli would never give up: Dinesh Karthik rips into Babar Azam, ends GOAT debateDinesh Karthik reignited the Kohli vs Babar debate after Pakistan's loss, calling Babar's shot "submission" and saying Virat Kohli would never give up under pressure.

Match vs AUS one of Sri Lanka's best performances in recent past: ShanakaT20 World Cup: Sri Lanka beat Australia in the T20 World Cup to qualify for the Super 8s. After the win, captain Dasun Shanaka called the game one of Sri Lanka's finest in the recent past.

Nissanka's Pallekele century floors Australia, ex-champs stare at early exitT20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka's blazing century powered Sri Lanka to an eight-wicket win over Australia, sealing a Super 8 berth and ending a three-year wait for victory over the Aussies in the shortest format.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi skips Class 10 Board exams, joins RR for IPL 2026India's teenage cricket sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi will not appear for his Class 10 board exams this year. His focus remains on IPL 2026 preparations after a stellar U19 World Cup performance.

Suryakumar Yadav, Kuldeep Yadav patch up after on-ground spat in Colombo: WatchT20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav and Kuldeep Yadav made up after their on-field spat during India's win over Pakistan, sharing a light-hearted video to show there is no rift in the camp.

India had enough runs to enforce follow-on vs Pakistan: R AshwinIND vs PAK: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin joked that India could have followed-on Pakistan in Colombo on Sunday. Ashwin's comments come after the India vs Pakistan match, where the Suryakumar Yadav side beat Pakistan by 61 runs.

England outlast resilient Italy to book Super 8 spot with win by 24 runs in KolkataENG vs ITA, T20 World Cup: England held their nerve to defeat spirited Italy by 24 runs at Eden Gardens, booking their Super 8 berth despite Ben Manenti's breathtaking 60, threatening a major upset in Kolkata.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
